questionListItems.title: I do not have a PAssion card. How can I sign up for one?

answer.body:
You can visit any Community Club/Centre to sign up for the PAssion EZ-Link Card. The card will be printed on the spot for you.


For more information on the PAssion Card programme, please visit https://www.onepa.gov.sg/passion-card.

questionListItems.title: What other avenues can I contribute to the PAssion Cares programme?

answer.body:
yuu Members have the option to donate their yuu Points towards PAssion CARES under the Rewards section in the yuu Rewards app. Members can redeem in multiples of 20 yuu Points (worth $0.10), 100 yuu points (worth $0.50) or 200 yuu points (worth $1.00) and contribute towards doing good for the community.


yuu points will be credited to your yuu Account by Jan 2023 and members must have a yuu Account with their PAssion Membership linked.

questionListItems.title: What is the PAssion Silver Concession Card?

answer.body:
The PAssion Silver Concession Card/PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) is an initiative under the Action Plan for Successful Ageing. We hope to encourage our seniors to age actively as they enjoy the many benefits and privileges offered by various organisations from the people, public and private sectors. All Singapore Citizens aged 60 and above (or upon turning 60) will receive PAssion Card benefits for free. All Permanent Residents aged 60 and above will continue to be eligible for the Senior Citizen Concession Card (purple) when they apply through TransitLink.


The PAssion Silver Card programme is a joint collaboration between the Ministry of Health, People's Association and Ministry of Transport with support from Land Transport Authority. The designs of the PAssion Silver Concession Card and PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) are as below.


  • PAssion Silver Concession Card - For Singapore Citizens aged 60 and above only

    • The PAssion Silver Concession Card will have your photograph on the front, along with the words "Senior Citizen Concession" printed below it.



  • PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) - For Singapore Citizens aged 60 and above only



  • For Singapore Permanent Resident Only

questionListItems.title: I have received the PAssion Silver Card (non-concession). Can I still apply for the PAssion Silver Concession card?

answer.body:
No. Each member can only hold either a PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) or a PAssion Silver Concession Card, but not both cards. Should you decide to convert your PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession) to the PAssion Silver Concession Card, there are four ways to do so:

  1. You may apply online via TransitLink website at www.transitlink.com.sg/lost-card-replacement or

  2. Through the TransitLink SimplyGo mobile app (Download links for: Apple App Store  | Google Play), or

  3. Approach any TransitLink Ticket Office. You will receive your PAssion Silver Concession Card within 2-4 weeks upon receipt of your application via the above application modes. Your existing yuu Points will be transferred to the replacement card and you can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.

  4. For an immediate card conversion, you may approach any TransitLink Concession Card Replacement Office, together with your original NRIC, a clear photocopy of the front and reverse sides of your NRIC, and a colour passport-sized photograph (non-returnable) that was taken within the last 3 months against a white background.


Your existing yuu Points will be transferred to the replacement card and you can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.


A fee of $8.10 applies for the first conversion, while the fee is $16.10/$15.10 for the second and subsequent card conversion. Enjoy discounted administrative fee when you apply for your conversion at Self Service Channels such as online and mobile app.

Anyone helping you to apply for the card conversion would have to present his or her own original NRIC/Passport in addition to the above-mentioned items.

questionListItems.title: Will my new PAssion Silver Concession card be on auto top-up by Bank Giro or Credit Card automatically?

answer.body:
No. Please re-apply as follows:


  • For Auto Top-Up by Bank GIRO (for POSB or DBS bank account), you may apply and link your new PAssion Silver Concession Card instantaneously at any General Ticketing Machine.

  • For Auto Top-Up by Credit Card, please apply via EZL's Mobile app.


If you have received your new PAssion Silver Concession card, you will need to apply and link your new card on the Simply Go app.  However, if you are unable to see your new card in the app, it could be that your previous card has not been terminated in the app and you may contact Simply Go Hotline – (1800-2255-663) provide your CAN ID to check if the previous card is still active in the system, have it terminated and then link the new card.

questionListItems.title: What should I do if my PAssion Silver Concession card/PAssion Silver card (non-concession) is damaged, E.G. due to wear and tear (referring to physical condition of the card)?

answer.body:
For an immediate replacement, you may approach any SimplyGo Ticketing Service Centre with your damaged PAssion Silver Concession Card, original NRIC and a colour passport-sized photograph (non-returnable) that was taken within the last 3 months against a white background.

Anyone helping you to apply for a replacement would have to present his or her own original NRIC/Passport in addition to the above-mentioned items.

You can also file a deferred refund for the remaining travel value and unused period of your Monthly Concession Pass (if applicable) at the SimplyGo Ticketing Service Centre. The amount will be pro-rated and refunded to you within 10 working days.

Please note that a replacement fee of $8.10 is applicable.

Your existing yuu Points will be transferred to the replacement card and you can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.

For PAssion Silver Card (Non-Concession):

You may approach your nearest CC for assistance if your card is damaged. Please note that a replacement fee of $7.50 will be applicable. The replacement card will be mailed to you in about 3 weeks.

You may also submit your request at the CC to recover any remaining travel value in your card. Any remaining value will be refunded to you via bank transfer or to another adult ez-link card [TEMPORARILY UNAVAILABLE] after 28 working days. The damaged card will be retained by the CC.

You can continue earning yuu Points on the replacement card in about 5 working days upon the receipt of the card.

questionListItems.title: What is the YUU rewards club?

answer.body:
yuu Rewards Club is a new multi-brand loyalty app-based programme that the People's Association is a partner in. This rewards PAssion Members at more places and enables members to accumulate more rewards, faster.
 
 yuu Members will be able to earn points from a wide-ranging coalition of diverse and market-leading brands that Singaporeans know and love. These brands include BreadTalk, CS Fresh, Cold Storage, Giant, Guardian Health & Beauty, 7 Eleven, Mandai.com, Toast Box and many more, encompassing over 1,000 merchant touchpoints islandwide where yuu Members can earn points. To find out more about how to use yuu, download the App here.
 
 Watch more about the yuu Rewards Club here.

questionListItems.title: Where can I find my PAssion card CAN/LID number?

answer.body:
You can find your 16-digit CAN/LID Number printed on the back of your physical PAssion Card; OR



Login using SingPass via MyPAssion App, tap on the "e-Card" icon at the footer and tap on the drop-down arrow at "View Card Info" to view your card details. (PAssion Card Number and CAN/LID Number).



If you are still unable to retrieve your CAN/LID Number, you may wish to contact PA Contact Centre at 6225 5322 (8am to 6pm, Mondays to Sundays, excluding Public Holidays) or submit your feedback via www.pa.gov.sg/feedback for further assistance.

questionListItems.title: How can I contribute to the PAssion Cares programme?

answer.body:
yuu Members have the option to donate their yuu Points towards PAssion CARES under the Rewards section. Members can redeem in denominations of 20, 100 or 200 yuu Points and contribute towards doing good for the community.


More information on PAssion CARES, please refer to: https://www.onepa.gov.sg/passion-card/passion-card-membership/passion-card-faq

questionListItems.title: How do I register for a user account on onePA?

answer.body:
• You will need a Singpass account to sign-in before you can proceed to create a user account with onePA.

  • The system will prompt you to create a onePA account, if applicable.

questionListItems.title: How do I log-in to onePA portal?

answer.body:
• The Login with Singpass button can be found at the top menu header bar 

  • Clicking it will prompt you to log in with your Singpass via password login or the Singpass mobile app.

  • Upon successful login, you shall be automatically redirected back to onePA.gov.sg.

questionListItems.title: How can I utilise a onePA Promo Code?

answer.body: During checkout at the payment summary page, you can enter the promo code if you already know the code and click apply. If you have collected the promo code earlier, you can click on “see all eligible promo codes”, select the relevant promo code and click apply.

questionListItems.title: How do I find a particular onePA class, facility, event or activity?

answer.body:
1. To search for courses by keywords and CC: Go to the course page by clicking “COURSES” at the top menu, followed by “All Courses” > Enter keyword like “yoga” into the “What*” box. Select the CC in the “Where” box (type the CC name). Click “Search” button.


2. To search for specific course code: Click on the “magnifying glass” icon at the top menu > Enter the course code into the search bar. Press the “enter” key or click on the “magnifying glass” again.

questionListItems.title: Why are some onePA badminton courts not offered online?

answer.body:
Each CC will have at least one badminton court available for online booking.


There are some badminton courts which are available only for over the counter bookings to cater to walk-in residents who may not be digitally savvy.


Rest assured that each CC will have at least one badminton court available for online booking.

questionListItems.title: Why are the CDC vouchers in fixed denominations? Can we choose or key in the exact amount of vouchers we want to use (for example, $1.50)?

answer.body:
The vouchers are in fixed denominations because it is less confusing for residents, especially the digitally less-savvy, and reduces the chance for errors to occur when residents key in the amount. The CDCs and Govtech had several rounds of consultations with residents and merchants to gather feedback on the design of the denominations.


For the CDC Vouchers to be used at heartland merchants and hawkers, the fixed denominations of $2, $5 and $10 allow residents to make purchases at different heartland shops and hawkers. For example, residents may patronise mini-marts or mom-and-pop shops, to purchase groceries or other essential household items, and services such as dental clinics, or hair salons.


For the CDC Vouchers to be used at supermarkets, the larger denominations ($5 and $10) will come in handy as the purchase amounts are typically larger due to the nature of goods sold at supermarkets.
